snippet: Federal officials are proposing sweeping new requirements for American health care facilities, but the health industry has balked at the hefty price tag associated with the changes.
abstract: Health and Human Services Dept is proposing sweeping new requirements for American health care facilities, from large hospitals to small group homes, intended to ensure their readiness to care for patients during disasters; health care industry has balked at hefty price tag associated with changes.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials are proposing sweeping new requirements for American health care facilities, but the health industry has balked at the hefty price tag associated with the changes.

headline.main: Citing Urgent Need, U.S. Calls on Hospitals to Hone Disaster Plans
headline.print_headline: Citing Urgent Need, U.S. Calls on Hospitals to Hone Disaster Plans
